reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not what I expected.
reviews.reviewText: After reading Signs of Life series & some of his other books. A story with a teenager that was basically confined to a bed & couldn't do anything for himself was not expected. This is a sad spiral this family goes down. First the mom dies then a son. Then one kid is injured severely. The father is still depressed over his first wife. He takes a lower paying job. Then starts a relationship with a woman he has no idea how dark she is. Then add all the medical bills & the family is forced to do the unthinkable. They end up in debt to the wrong people. Now they are desperate. What will they do to keep each other alive?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This was an original, well written, fast moving story told from the perspectives of a desperate man and his bedridden, brain damaged son. The story is told in first person narrative, so there are not long, drawn out scenes to develop characters. The plot gets straight to the point and doesn't stop. Some people may view the elements of the plot as somewhat simplistic and unrealistic in spots, but it was the lack of deep complexity that made it work.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not my usual
reviews.reviewText: This isn't my usual genre, but it was good. Kept me on my toes and wanting to turn the page.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Creston Mapes always writes a good read. This one was probably my favorite so far. I loved the way the broken people who turned their backs on God came back to Him. They found Jesus right where they left Him. Waiting for His children to come back to Him. Evil is real but so is God’s protection over us. A great reminder that when we believe Jesus honors our faith in Him. Also a great reminder that when a person can’t speak he can hear. So speak peace and believe. I loved this book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Frim the inside view of a totally paralized man
reviews.reviewText: Mixed up with mob type people and borrowed money the action is intense!Great ending though! Good Christian thought provoking messages too. I would highly recommend this book. Makes you glad for what you have in your own life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exciting and faith-filled thriller!
reviews.reviewText: This was a unique, intriguing, and unputdownable thriller. It's the very definition of “page-turner." I was hooked from the first sentence to the last.I liked Hale instantly. His narration was very engaging. I loved how strong his faith was. Despite everything he was going through, it never wavered. Talk about inspiring! I was glad he had a friend like Gilbert. His belief in Hale, his loyalty, and the way he still treated him so normally (unlike some other people) was so nice to see. On the other hand, Hale’s stepmom was a nightmare! Cruella de Vil was quite an apt nickname for her.If you’re looking for an exciting and faith-filled thriller, grab a copy of this book. You won’t be disappointed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Always stretches your belief
reviews.reviewText: Love this story that has some hard truths in it about life. We often seem to think of God wrongly as some cosmic genie granting our wishes because we ask. One will never stretch or grow in faith without adversity in our lives. I like this ending without knowing if he really was restored. Beautiful!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book got my attention right away, and kept it all the way to the end. With the added benefit of having a few Scripture lessons appropriately weaved into the storyline. I recommend this book as a casual read that is not just another "lessonless" book that we read..

I could not put this book down. Every page was filled with suspense. I love how this author tells the story, never a dull moment.We have a son with severe special needs so this story deeply touched my heart. Dare I say, it even sparked new hope?

This book is a great read, couldn’t be better. Please read it and enjoy it too.It’s clean, involves best friend, a little hopeful romance, some kick downs good humour, suspense, betrayal, forgiveness and a whole lot more. Truly great!
Well written suspense shifting from one dramatic situation to another. Story told from each character’s perspective adds to the tension.
The ability to put the reader inside a character, to look out through their eyes, is rare. Mapes flips between his continually. Well done!

Life has changed so much in a short time, mom died, dad met a woman and she got him to marry her. Was not impressed with her, she is totally opposite of mom. Then my brother and I go on church outing and there’s a terrible accident.
